rules.title: Establishment of the Centre
rules.summary: Establishes the International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes to provide facilities for conciliation and arbitration of investment disputes between Contracting States and nationals of other Contracting States.

rules.title: Seat of the Centre
rules.summary: The seat of the Centre shall be at the principal office of the World Bank, subject to relocation by a two-thirds majority decision of the Administrative Council.

rules.title: Functions of the Administrative Council
rules.summary: Administrative Council adopts administrative and financial regulations, institutional rules, and conciliation and arbitration rules. Key decisions require a two-thirds majority.

rules.title: Qualifications of Panel Members
rules.summary: Panel members must be persons of high moral character and recognized competence, capable of independent judgment, with particular emphasis on legal competence for arbitrators.

rules.title: Jurisdiction of the Centre
rules.summary: ICSID jurisdiction covers legal disputes arising directly out of an investment between a Contracting State and a national of another Contracting State, based on written consent which cannot be unilaterally withdrawn.

rules.title: Consent to Arbitration as Exclusive Remedy
rules.summary: Consent to ICSID arbitration excludes other remedies unless otherwise stated. A State may require exhaustion of local remedies as a condition of consent.

rules.title: Prohibition of Diplomatic Protection
rules.summary: Contracting States may not exercise diplomatic protection regarding disputes submitted to ICSID arbitration unless the award is not complied with.

rules.title: Request for Arbitration
rules.summary: Arbitration proceedings are instituted by written request to the Secretary-General containing party details, issues in dispute, and proof of consent.

rules.title: Constitution of the Tribunal
rules.summary: Tribunal consists of a sole arbitrator or an uneven number as agreed by the parties; default is three arbitrators if no agreement exists.

rules.title: Appointment by the Chairman
rules.summary: If tribunal constitution fails within 90 days, the Chairman appoints missing arbitrators, who must not be nationals of the disputing States.

rules.title: Nationality of Arbitrators
rules.summary: The majority of arbitrators must be nationals of States other than the disputing State and the investor’s State, unless appointed by party agreement.

rules.title: Competence of the Tribunal
rules.summary: The Tribunal has Kompetenz-Kompetenz and decides objections to its jurisdiction or competence, either preliminarily or with the merits.

rules.title: Applicable Law
rules.summary: Tribunal applies the law agreed by the parties, or failing agreement, the host State’s law and applicable international law. No non liquet allowed.

rules.title: Evidence and Site Visits
rules.summary: Tribunal may call for documents, evidence, and conduct site visits or inquiries as necessary.

rules.title: Procedure
rules.summary: Proceedings follow the Convention and applicable Arbitration Rules unless otherwise agreed by the parties. Tribunal resolves procedural gaps.

rules.title: Failure to Appear
rules.summary: Non-appearance does not constitute admission. Tribunal may proceed after notice and grace period.

rules.title: Incidental and Additional Claims
rules.summary: Tribunal may decide incidental, additional, or counterclaims arising directly from the dispute if within consent and jurisdiction.

rules.title: Provisional Measures
rules.summary: Tribunal may recommend provisional measures to preserve the rights of either party.

rules.title: The Award
rules.summary: Award must be in writing, reasoned, decided by majority, and signed. Dissenting opinions permitted. Publication requires party consent.

rules.title: Dispatch and Rectification of Award
rules.summary: Certified copies dispatched by the Secretary-General. Tribunal may rectify errors or decide omitted questions within 45 days.

rules.title: Interpretation of the Award
rules.summary: Either party may seek interpretation of an award. Enforcement may be stayed pending interpretation.

rules.title: Revision of the Award
rules.summary: Revision allowed for discovery of decisive new facts within strict temporal limits.

rules.title: Annulment of the Award
rules.summary: Annulment available on five exhaustive grounds via an ad hoc Committee appointed by the Chairman.

rules.title: Binding Force of Award
rules.summary: Awards are binding and not subject to appeal, save for Convention remedies.

rules.title: Recognition and Enforcement
rules.summary: Contracting States must recognize and enforce awards as final domestic judgments.

rules.title: Immunity from Execution
rules.summary: State immunity from execution under domestic law is preserved.

rules.title: Replacement of Arbitrators
rules.summary: Tribunal composition remains stable; vacancies are filled per Convention rules.

rules.title: Disqualification of Arbitrators
rules.summary: Arbitrators may be challenged for manifest lack of required qualities.

rules.title: Decision on Disqualification
rules.summary: Disqualification decided by remaining members or the Chairman if necessary.

rules.title: Allocation of Costs in Arbitration
rules.summary: Tribunal determines allocation of arbitration costs unless parties agree otherwise.

rules.title: Place of Proceedings
rules.summary: Proceedings held at the Centre’s seat unless otherwise provided.

rules.title: Alternative Venues
rules.summary: Proceedings may be held at PCA or other approved locations by agreement.
